instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2610: What is 820-2610? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
threads.message:
Good evening,

i have a problem with a 17" MBP from 2009 (810-2610).
WIFI is missing on this board (macOS shows "No hardware installed").
Everything else (camera, etc.) works fine.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL> is present and the connector seems good.
I already tried a known good wifi-card.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
threads.message: And I already tried another screen in case the plug is faulty. But WIFI is still not detected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>MINI_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>MINI_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>:3.3V
<SIGNAL>PCIE_MINI_PRSNT_L</SIGNAL>: 0V
<CAPACITOR>C3430</CAPACITOR>/31 are good and so is L3401 (0 ohm  resistance between pins 1 and 2 and between 3 and 4 and also OL between pins 1 and 3).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>MINI_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>:3.3V"
This is not good.
Check <SIGNAL>MINI_CLKREQ_Q_L</SIGNAL>; should have 0V, when wifi is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
threads.message:
I changed L3404 now <SIGNAL>MINI_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> is low. 
I don't know how i measured <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN</SIGNAL> 5v... maybe i measured <SIGNAL>PP5V_WLAN_F</SIGNAL> instead by taking the wrong pin of L3404...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI
threads.message: WIFI is working now. Thank you for your help! :-)
